seg.seg: The month come to an end. The 10th month. By the 10th day of the month, to totalize (the things given) to Śimprāyo* the Śopo*, we have milled wheat: thirty-nine piculs, eight pecks. (It is) Śāṅke (who) milled.
For *wrätsaise to/of Prajñakarasoma, we have bought (by/for?) ourselves cow's ghee: three pints, by (the cost of) wheat: one picul, five pecks.

By the order of Kurriṅkāte* the Simā*, the levies of mid-summer have been apportioned back (to us). (So) we have given wheat to Cāsām, a military (man) on the way to Yāywye*/Yāywyeṃ*: thirteen piculs, five pecks. There is an official receipt.
For the Full Moon of the 11th month, we have bought (by/for?) ourselves mlyokotau oil: four pints, by (the cost of) eight pecks of wheat.
For patalakṣāṣṣe*(?), Pakeñe has worked for four days. He has taken wheat as the payment: one picul, two pecks.
We have bought Ynaikenta-shoes for Mikkaswiñi, by (the cost) of wheat: five pecks.
Dharmarakṣite the Sthere has recognized. Ślawarme the Sthere has recognized.
At (the occasion of) warwaltsai's parramañi, we have bought (by/for?) ourselves cow's ghee: three pints, (each pint) for five pecks of wheat. (So) the wheat that we gave: one picul, five pecks.
We have bought (by/for?) ourselves *paṣkaro oil: four pints, by (the cost of) wheat: eight pecks.
We have bought (by/for?) ourselves tsyāṅk: three pints, by six pecks of wheat.
We have given away/back to Dharmarakṣite the Sthere the wheat concerning *āslya(?): five piculs, two pecks.

The month has come to the end. The 11th month. On the 6th day of the month, for kapyāres' clothes, the novice Toṅke has conveyed wheat to the city/town for sale: ten piculs. The novice's finger-measure.

p.note: Dated to the Tang period due to the use of ṣau (from Chin. 抄 chāo "receipt") and other loanwords (80, 103-106).
There is also an image of this manuscript on the Ryukoku University site.
